sentence.Network_en: It would seem more sensible to apply standards flexibly rather than rigidly.
sentence.Network_cn: 灵活地运用标准比死守标准会显得更合情合理。

sentence.Network_en: Many writers at this time held rigidly dogmatic views.
sentence.Network_cn: 这时期有很多作家固执己见。

sentence.Network_en: She stood rigidly and stared into the room.
sentence.Network_cn: 她直直地站在那里，凝视着屋内。

entry.tran: (法律、制度或体系)严格的，刻板的，不可变更的
entry.def: Laws, rules, or systems that are rigid cannot be changed or varied, and are therefore considered to be rather severe.

example.ex: Several colleges in our study have rigid rules about student conduct...
example.tran: 在我们的研究中，有几所大学制定了严格的学生行为规则。

example.ex: Hospital routines for nurses are very rigid.
example.tran: 医院中护士的日常工作非常刻板。

entry.def: If you disapprove of someone because you think they are not willing to change their way of thinking or behaving, you can describe them as rigid .

example.ex: She was a fairly rigid person who had strong religious views...
example.tran: 她相当顽固，宗教观念极强。

example.ex: My father is very rigid in his thinking.
example.tran: 我父亲的思想非常顽固。

entry.tran: 坚硬的;刚性的;不易弯曲的
entry.def: A rigid substance or object is stiff and does not bend, stretch, or twist easily.

entry.tran: (常因震惊或害怕)身体僵直的，不能动弹的，呆住的
entry.def: If someone goes rigid, their body becomes very straight and stiff, usually as a result of shock or fear.

example.ex: Andrew went rigid when he saw a dog, any dog, anywhere.
example.tran: 安德鲁过去只要看见狗，无论在哪里，无论什么狗，都会吓得一动不动。

auth_sentence.content: He grew up in a rigidly religious atmosphere.
auth_sentence.res_content: He grew up in a rigidly religious atmosphere.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He grew up in a rigidly religious atmosphere.

auth_sentence.content: Sam sat rigidly...and glowered at mesa picture of dumb insolence.
auth_sentence.res_content: Sam sat rigidly...and glowered at mesa picture of dumb insolence.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Sam sat rigidly...and glowered at mesa picture of dumb insolence.

auth_sentence.content: Everything sits rigidly to a strict baseline grid.
auth_sentence.res_content: Everything sits rigidly to a strict baseline grid.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Everything sits rigidly to a strict baseline grid.

means.word_mean: 僵硬地;严厉地;严格地;固执地

sentences.en: The curriculum is rigidly prescribed from an early age.
sentences.cn: 自儿童时起即已开始有严格的课程设置。

sentences.en: My correspondence happens to be rigidly controlled.
sentences.cn: 我的信件恰巧受到严格控制。

sentences.en: The play,whose style is rigidly formal,is typical of the period.
sentences.cn: 这剧本是那个时期的典型作品,风格拘谨刻板。

sentences.en: All the units interlock with one another rigidly.
sentences.cn: 所有的元件牢牢地连锁在一起。

sentences.en: His gaze was rigidly fixed ahead.
